Package org.theusaf.BattlefieldChess.game

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.theusaf.BattlefieldChess.util.Copyable<Piece>
      • org.theusaf.BattlefieldChess.game.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Pawn
    public class Piece
extends Copyable<Piece>
    Represents a piece on the board.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected Board BOARD
      The board the piece is on
      protected Character character
      The piece's character and stats
      protected Position position
      The position of the piece
      protected GameTeam team
      The team the piece is on

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Piece​(Board board)
      Constructs a piece (no location, default team WHITE)
      Piece​(Board board, Position position, GameTeam team)
      Constructs a piece with a location on the board with a custom team.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece​(Board board)
        Constructs a piece (no location, default team WHITE)
        Parameters:
        board - The board the piece should be given a position on later

      • Piece

        public Piece​(Board board,
             Position position,
             GameTeam team)
        Constructs a piece with a location on the board with a custom team.
        Parameters:
        board - The board the piece is located on
        position - The position the piece is located on.
        The piece will automatically be added to the position if the position is not null
        team - The team the piece is on

    • Method Detail

      • isOnBoard

        protected boolean isOnBoard()
        Returns whether the piece is actually on the board.
        Returns:
        Whether the piece has a position on the board

      • frontDirectionMultiplier

        protected int frontDirectionMultiplier()
        Returns an integer representing the 'forwards' direction.
        Returns:
        1 if the team is WHITE and -1 if the team is BLACK.

      • frontDirectionMultiplier

        protected int frontDirectionMultiplier​(int n)
        Returns an integer representing 'n' rows forwards.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of rows forwards
        Returns:
        A positive integer if WHITE and negative if BLACK

      • getPossiblePositions

        public Position[] getPossiblePositions()
        Gets all plausible positions the piece can move to.
        Returns:
        A list of positions the piece can theoretically move to

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo​(Position position)
        Moves the piece to another position.
        This also removes the piece from the current position.
        Parameters:
        position - The new position to move the piece to

      • canMoveTo

        public boolean canMoveTo​(Position position)
        Determines whether the piece can actually move to a specified location.

        Note:

        This method does not account for putting the King in check.

        TODO: Add a checkForChecks method and update this documentation.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to check
        Returns:
        Whether the position given is a possible move

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition()
        Returns the position the piece is on.
        Returns:
        The position the piece is on

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition​(Position position)
        Puts the piece on the given position.

        Note:

        This method will not remove the piece from its old position if it had an old position.

        Parameters:
        position - The position to put the piece on

      • getCharacter

        public Character getCharacter()
        Gets the character for this piece.
        Returns:
        The character for this piece

      • setCharacter

        public void setCharacter​(Character character)
        Sets the character for this piece.
        Parameters:
        character - The character to apply to this piece

      • getTeam

        public GameTeam getTeam()
        Gets the team this piece is on.
        Returns:
        The team the piece is on

      • setTeam

        public void setTeam​(GameTeam team)
        Sets the team this piece is on.
        Parameters:
        team - The team to assign the piece to

      • copySpecific

        protected Piece copySpecific()
        Generates a clone of this piece.
        The cloned piece will also contain a clone of its character and position. TODO: prevent infinite loop
        Overrides:
        copySpecific in class Copyable<Piece>
        Returns:
        The clone of this piece
